intro: Rosa serafinii subsp. veridica, commonly known as the Sefid Sefid rose, is a rare and elusive species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its delicate pink to white flowers, which bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its foliage consists of finely divided, aromatic leaves, and it is known for its hardy nature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
